div.head: ❧ By the King.
❧ A Proclamation concerning the well-ordering the Trade of making and selling of Soape.
div.p: WHereas Wee haue declared by two former Proclamations Our Princely care for the aduancement of the natiue Commodities of Our Kingdomes, the imployment of many of Our poore people, and the reformation of diuers former abuses in making of Soape: Wee now finding by experience, that many factious and refractory persons haue not onely disobeyed Our Royall Commandements, but haue studied diuers new wayes to hinder all Our good intentions to Our louing Subiects, some by vsing of Castile, Venice, Smyrna, and English hard Soape from the Westerne parts, and by dissoluing of it to multiply or increase it, who formerly neuer vsed any of that kinde in that maner, some by bringing in great quantity of Fishoyle Soape, and other Soape from Scotland, France and Holland, and diuers other places, some by procuring the increase of making of Soape in places where small quantities of Soape were formerly made, seruing onely for the places neare adioyning, and dispersing it ouer the Realme, where was neuer vse of that Soape before, others by perswading of Our Subiects that they could instruct housholders, and other priuate persons to make Soape at easie rates for their vses, therein abusing and deceiuing them with purpose to cause them for a while to forbeare the vse of the new made Soape, hoping thereby to ouerthrow the vse of making Soap of the natiue commodities of this Kingdome. And besides all these inuentions, they haue not onely raysed the prices of the old Soape to such excessiue rates, that Our louing Subiects haue payed euen heere in Our Citie of London, sixe pence a pound for the same, and in many other parts of Our Kingdome eight pence, tenne pence, and twelue pence the pound, which was wont to be sold for three pence, or three pence halfe peny; But in like manner also to bring the new white Soape into dislike, they haue purposely abused and falsified it, and haue maliciously presumed to sell it by retaile for like inordinate prices. For the remedy of all which inconueniences, and for the better preuenting of their malice in the like attempts, We haue resolued with the aduice of Our Priuie Councell to settle and establish the Manufacture of Soape, according to such powers and prouisions, as in cases of like nature haue from time to time beene ordered and put in execution.

And therefore for the better finding out and discouery of all offenders against Our said two former Proclamations, and such as shall disobey Our further Commands in this Our present Edict, and the Decrees of Our Court of Star-Chamber, and Letters Patents made concerning the premises; Our will and pleasure is, and Wee doe hereby require and Command, that the Keeper of Our Great Seale, or Our Treasurer, Chancellor, and Barrons of Our Exchequer, or the Chancellor of Our Dutchie of Lancaster, for the time being respectiuely, shall and doe award such and so many Commissions, to such persons, and of such tenour and effect as they shall thinke fit, for the rectifying of the prices of Soape vpon any such complaint, as in that behalfe shall bee made vnto them, and for the examining and finding out of all offences and offenders against Our Proclamations, Decrees, and Letters Patents, to the end that aswell the Importers, bringers in, carriers, and makers of all Soape prohibited, and the sellers of Soape at prices excessiue, as the buyers, sellers, spenders, and receiuers thereof, may receiue condigne punishment for their seuerall offences.

And because some complaints haue deene made to Vs, and to Our Priuie Councell, by some particular Tradesmen; As namely, Silke-Diers, Wooll-combers, Weauers, Say-thickers, Fullers, and the like, that their Trades doe require some other sorts of Soape, then such as now is vsed and made by the said Corporation, and other then that which was formerly commonly made in Our Citie of London, according to the quality of their seuerall Manufactures.

Therfore Our further will and pleasure is, and Wee doe hereby straitly charge and command the Gouernour for the time being, and the Society of the Soape-makers, And doe by these presents authorize them, and appoint that they shall and may from time to time make, and cause to be made such quantities, and such a proportion of any other sort of soft Soape, as shall bee requisite for the necessary vse of the sayd Tradesmen in their said seuerall Trades onely, and not otherwise, nor for any other vse whatsoeuer. Prouided alwayes, that no soft Soape be fold to the sayd Tradesmen by the said Corporation, at the place where it shall bee made, for aboue three pence the pound.

And to the end that Soape shall not bee sold at any such excessiue prices and rates as now it is, by the fraud of the vndue-makers and Retaylers, but at such indifferent and moderate rates and prices as may bee conuenient betwixt the Buyer and the Seller: It is Our will and pleasure, and Wee doe hereby straitly charge and command, that the Maior, Bayliffe, or other chiefe Officer in euery Citie and Towne corporate, with the assistance of two of the next Iustices of the Peace of that County, or the two next adioining Iustices of the Peace where the said Retaylers dwell out of a Citie or Towne Corporate, vpon any complaint that shall bee made of any excessiue rates or prices, doe set such rates and prices vpon all Soape that shall bee Retayled, as they in their best Iudgements shall thinke fit and reasonable, consideration being by them had, aswell of the setled price payed to the Corporation, as of the Charge of Carriage, Sea-aduenture, and other charges and casualties thereunto belonging, with fit and reasonable gaines to the Retayler.

And if it shall happen, that in any of the places aforesaid, there shall be vnfit prices set, whereby the Buyer, or Seller, may haue iust cause of complaint, then in euery such case vpon complaint thereof made, Our will and pleasure is, that all such pretended vndue proceedings, shall bee examined and rectified, by such Commissioners as shall bee hereafter nominated and appointed by the Keeper of Our Great Seale, or Our Treasurer, Chancellor, and Barons of Our Exchequer, or the Chancellor of Our Dutchie of Lancaster.

And because the said Gouernour, Assistants, and Fellowship of Soape-makers, are forced to bee at excessiue charges, by imployment of seuerall men in searching, seising, and other discouery of Soape, made or put to sale, contrary to the tenour of the said Proclamations, Decrees, and Letters Patents, which being falsely, or corruptly made, or being put to fale vnmarked, contrary to the said Decrees, Proclamations, and Letters Patents is to bee destroyed, as hath beene vsed by the Law, and common custome of the Realme, whereby the said Fellowship receiue no recompence for their charge and expence; Wee are therefore well pleased, that vpon complaint made in Our Court of Star-Chamber, or Exchequer, of such falsities, corruptions, or abuses, that competent allowance for their charge and expence bee made vnto them, by that Court where they shall complaine, out of the fines that shall be set vpon the Delinquents: And this Our Proclamation shall bee a sufficient warrant for making and giuing such allowance.

And for discouery of such falsities, corruptions, and abuses, their Officers, and Ministers, may enter in to search, and seize the same in any Houses, Cellers, Shops, Ware-houses, and other places whatsoeuer, aswell within Liberties, as without; Requiring, and hereby straitly Charging and Commanding, all Maiors, Sheriffes, Bayliffes, Constables, and other Our Officers, and louing Subiects, to bee ayding and assisting vnto them in the doing and executing thereof without excuse or delay.

And because Wee haue prouided by this and Our form • r Proclamations, Letters Patents and Decrees, that a sufficient quantitie of good and vsefull Soape to be sold at reasonable prices, shall at all times be in readinesse for the vse of our people, and Wee are resolued so to continue Our care, that euery man may bee serued thereof at euery Market-Towne, without being put to any vnnecessary trauaile there-abouts, so as none shall bee occasioned to vse any the shifts or inuentions aforesaid. Therefore Wee will and command, that no person or persons, other then such as by the Decree in Our Court of Starre-Chamber heretofore made, are, or shall bee permitted or allowed, doe at any time hereafter presume to make any kinde of Soape in their priuate houses or elswhere, either for their owne vse or otherwise, vpon paine of incurring Our heauie displeasure, and such punishment as their contempt in that behalfe shall demerit.

And Wee doe hereby also straitly charge and command, that no person or persons whatsoeuer, either Our owne naturall borne Subiects, Denizens or Strangers, Merchants, Mariners, Artificers, or any other doe hereafter import or bring in, or attempt to import or bring into this Our Kingdome of England, or Dominion of Wales, any Soape from Our Kingdomes of Scotland or Ireland, or any manner or kinde of Soape, hard or soft whatsoeuer from any Forreigne parts, or to transport, Load, or cary any manner of soft Soape not marked with the Marke in that behalfe ordained, and hereby prohibited, from or into any parts or places of this Our said Kingdome of England, or Dominion of Wales, vpon paine of Our heauy displeasure, and to vndergoe such further penalties and punishments as in cases of like nature are vsually inflicted vpon the contemners of Our Royall command and authority.

And for the better performance and execution, of all and euery the premisses, Wee doe further Charge and Command, all and singuler the Officers of Our Customes, within all and euery the Ports, and Hauens of Our said Kingdome, and Dominions, and the Creekes and members thereof, as also within Our Cinque Ports, and the members thereof: That they and euery of them doe not onely forbeare to take any entrie, or entries, or giue any Bill, or Warrant, for vnlading, or landing of any Soape prohibited as aforesaid, but doe also cause seizure and stay to bee made thereof to Our vse, vpon paine of forfeiture of his or their Offices respectiuely, and vndergoing Our heauy displeasure, and such other punishments as their neglects and contempts herein shall be found to deserue.

And wee doe also straitly Charge and Command all Maiors, Sheriffes, Iustices of Peace, Constables, Headboroughes, Tythingmen, and all other Our Officers, and Ministers, aswell of Our Admiralty, as also Our Officers of the Cinque Ports, and all other Our louing Subiects to whom it shall or may appertaine, that they and euery of them at all times hereafter, and from time to time, be ayding and assisting to the said Searchers, and their Deputies, and to such Our Commissioners, as shall bee from time to time appointed for or about this seruice: And also to bee from time to time likewise ayding and assisting to all Our Customers, Searchers, Wayters, and all other person, or persons, therunto Deputed by the said Searchers, or their Deputies, in and for the Seizing, Searching for, or carying away of all such prohibited Soape, imported, brought in, or Landed, or hereafter to be imported, brought in, Landed, made, bought, sold, vented, or disposed, contrary to this Our Royall Command.

And Wee doe hereby require Our Attourney Generall for the time being, that from time to time he carefully proceed in Our Court of Starr-Chamber, or our Court of Exchequer against all such person and persons that shall presume to offend or not yeeld obedience to Our command in the premisses.
div.closer:
Giuen at Our Court at Theobalds the thirteenth day of Iuly, in the tenth yeere of Our Reigne of England, Scotland, France and Ireland.
God saue the King.
